intro: Radicula armoracia, commonly known as celery. It is a biennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia, characterized by its hollow, ridged stems and aromatic leaves. The plant belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and dill. Its roots are often used in cooking, though the leaves and stems are also edible. Radicula armoracia thrives in cool climates and requires well-drained, fertile soil for optimal growth.
